section_01.section_summary: The story begins with a boy named Davy reading to his uncle, Anthony Croft, who is blind. Anthony is a skilled violinist who believes that the secret to everything beautiful and true is hidden in the strings of his instrument. Davy and Anthony have a close relationship, and Anthony asks Davy to paint a picture with words, describing the landscape outside. Davy's vivid description sparks Anthony to play his violin, filling the air with rich and harmonious music. Anthony's past is also revealed, showing his dislike for school and his love for music and the outdoors, which brought him peace and understanding.

section_02.section_summary: The teacher often struggled to keep her students engaged, especially on hot afternoons, and Anthony would sometimes sneak out of the window to play with a tuning fork. As he grew older, Anthony was considered the laziest boy in the village, but this was because he was more interested in pursuing his own interests and learning through personal experience. He was a curious boy, always asking questions about the world around him, such as why the sun drives away the stars and what makes seeds grow. Despite not being in school for the full year, Anthony educated himself by exploring the woods and learning about nature, discovering hidden gems like Mayflowers and rare flowers. He spent his free time listening to and imitating the sounds of wild birds, demonstrating his unique and self-directed approach to learning.
